meta.title: Main Government Structure
meta.description: Constitutional structures of NYC, New York State, and U.S. Federal government

nodes.label: NYC Charter
nodes.factoid: Foundational document defining the structure and powers of New York City government.

nodes.label: Mayor
nodes.factoid: Elected citywide executive. Oversees agencies, prepares the budget, and enforces city laws.

nodes.label: Comptroller
nodes.factoid: Fiscal watchdog and auditor. Oversees the city's financial operations and pensions.

nodes.label: Public Advocate
nodes.factoid: Monitors city agencies and acts as a public ombudsman.

nodes.label: City Council
nodes.factoid: 51-member legislative body that passes local laws and approves the budget.

nodes.label: NYC Departments & Agencies
nodes.factoid: Agencies implementing city policies across health, housing, planning, and services.

nodes.label: Administrative Code
nodes.factoid: Compilation of permanent local laws enacted by the City Council.

nodes.label: Rules of the City of New York
nodes.factoid: Regulations issued by city agencies to implement the Administrative Code.

nodes.label: NYC Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual financial plan allocating funds across city agencies and boroughs.

nodes.label: Borough Advisory Structure
nodes.factoid: Advisory and coordinating bodies at the borough level with NO legislative or executive power. Provide community input on land use, budgets, and services.

nodes.label: Manhattan Borough President
nodes.factoid: Elected borough executive with advisory role. Appoints Community Board members.

nodes.label: Brooklyn Borough President
nodes.factoid: Elected borough executive with advisory role. Appoints Community Board members.

nodes.label: Bronx Borough President
nodes.factoid: Elected borough executive with advisory role. Appoints Community Board members.

nodes.label: Queens Borough President
nodes.factoid: Elected borough executive with advisory role. Appoints Community Board members.

nodes.label: Staten Island Borough President
nodes.factoid: Elected borough executive with advisory role. Appoints Community Board members.

nodes.label: Manhattan Community Boards (12)
nodes.factoid: 12 advisory boards with up to 50 appointed members each. Review land use and budget proposals.

nodes.label: Brooklyn Community Boards (18)
nodes.factoid: 18 advisory boards with up to 50 appointed members each. Review land use and budget proposals.

nodes.label: Bronx Community Boards (12)
nodes.factoid: 12 advisory boards with up to 50 appointed members each. Review land use and budget proposals.

nodes.label: Queens Community Boards (14)
nodes.factoid: 14 advisory boards with up to 50 appointed members each. Review land use and budget proposals.

nodes.label: Staten Island Community Boards (3)
nodes.factoid: 3 advisory boards with up to 50 appointed members each. Review land use and budget proposals.

nodes.label: NY State Constitution
nodes.factoid: The foundational document defining the structure, powers, and limits of New York State's government.

nodes.label: Governor of New York
nodes.factoid: Elected chief executive responsible for enforcing state laws, proposing the budget, and appointing officials.

nodes.label: NY State Legislature
nodes.factoid: Bicameral body composed of the Assembly and Senate. Enacts laws and adopts the state budget.

nodes.label: State Judicial System
nodes.factoid: Unified court system led by the Chief Judge and Court of Appeals, interpreting the Constitution and laws of New York.

nodes.label: State Comptroller
nodes.factoid: Independent fiscal officer overseeing state finances, audits, and the public pension system.

nodes.label: State Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual fiscal plan developed by the Governor and enacted by the Legislature to fund state operations.

nodes.label: NY State Assembly
nodes.factoid: Lower chamber of the State Legislature, representing districts proportionally by population.

nodes.label: NY State Senate
nodes.factoid: Upper chamber of the State Legislature, representing districts by region.

nodes.label: NY Consolidated Laws
nodes.factoid: Compilation of permanent laws organized by subject, enacted by the State Legislature.

nodes.label: NY Codes, Rules & Regulations (NYCRR)
nodes.factoid: Detailed regulations issued by state agencies to implement state laws.

nodes.label: State Agencies
nodes.factoid: Departments that implement laws and deliver services in areas like health, education, and transportation.

nodes.label: Public Authorities
nodes.factoid: Legal frameworks establishing public authorities across city, state, and interstate jurisdictions.

nodes.label: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing NYC subway, buses, and regional commuter rail systems.

nodes.label: New York State Thruway Authority
nodes.factoid: State authority operating the Thruway highway system across New York.

nodes.label: New York Power Authority (NYPA)
nodes.factoid: State authority providing electric power generation and transmission.

nodes.label: Dormitory Authority (DASNY)
nodes.factoid: State authority financing construction of schools, hospitals, and public facilities.

nodes.label: Empire State Development (ESD)
nodes.factoid: State authority for economic development and business incentives.

nodes.label: Battery Park City Authority (BPCA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing Battery Park City neighborhood in Manhattan.

nodes.label: Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation (RIOC)
nodes.factoid: State authority overseeing Roosevelt Island operations.

nodes.label: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
nodes.factoid: Bi-state agency managing bridges, tunnels, airports, and seaports in the NY-NJ region.

nodes.label: New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA)
nodes.factoid: City public authority providing affordable housing for NYC residents.

nodes.label: U.S. Constitution
nodes.factoid: The supreme law of the United States that establishes the federal government and divides powers among its branches.

nodes.label: President of the United States
nodes.factoid: The head of the Executive Branch responsible for enforcing federal laws, directing foreign policy, and serving as Commander-in-Chief.

nodes.label: U.S. Congress
nodes.factoid: Bicameral legislature composed of the Senate and House of Representatives. Enacts federal laws and controls appropriations.

nodes.label: U.S. Senate
nodes.factoid: Upper chamber of Congress that confirms appointments, ratifies treaties, and participates in lawmaking.

nodes.label: U.S. House of Representatives
nodes.factoid: Lower chamber of Congress that introduces revenue bills and represents districts proportionally by population.

nodes.label: Supreme Court of the United States
nodes.factoid: The highest court in the federal judiciary, interprets the Constitution and resolves disputes under federal law.

nodes.label: Federal Court System
nodes.factoid: Composed of U.S. Courts of Appeals and District Courts that handle federal cases nationwide.

nodes.label: Federal Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual fiscal plan proposed by the President and enacted by Congress to fund federal operations and programs.

nodes.label: Federal Agencies
nodes.factoid: Departments and independent agencies implementing federal laws and programs across areas like defense, health, and environment.

nodes.label: United States Code
nodes.factoid: Compilation of permanent federal statutes organized by subject, enacted by Congress.

nodes.label: Code of Federal Regulations (CFR)
nodes.factoid: Detailed regulations issued by federal agencies to implement federal statutes.
